I just got done mapping Ike as well, from an altitude of 75 kilometers. It's a little bit more complete than the previous Ike map. I'm moving on to map Gilly and Eve next.

**Edited <time datetime="2012-09-23T05:52:25Z" title="09/23/2012 05:52  AM" data-short="11 yr">September 23, 2012</time> by blueshirt21**

You can upload csv files to mrdia fire or drop box then put a link here. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Tommy, which Rover is that?

That's the Prometheus Solar Rover from the Lionhead Aerospace thread.

It's just strip down to the basic frame and then I added what I wanted.

It is also the larger first version as the newer one is much smaller.

I'd like to have both sizes, but I'm unsure how to rename all the files properly, so I'm staying with this one for now at least.

[http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/12106-0-16-Lionhead-Aerospace-Inc-Rover-v4-1-New-update-13-09](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/12106-0-16-Lionhead-Aerospace-Inc-Rover-v4-1-New-update-13-09)

I have a 150 MB CSV file of Laythe elevation data, with a new orbiter currently collecting more.

I'll dump the data here after my kethane map is done.

Also: a map

Would someone help me figure out how to use quikgrid? I can't figure it out.

The biggest issue is that you have to edit the initial CVS file to be comma delimited, not semicolon. then you can load the file and have it work. I know i have a basic how to for it somewhere on these forums.

The isamapper does not generate a genuine csv file. You have to open the isa file in notepad and do a mass find/replace so the colons are changed to comma's.

Nice maps sas. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I got my Mun data to work thanks to the above post, but how do you get data for other planets/moons? I'm currently mapping Tylo.

Edit: Oh hey I figured it out. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> ![Lok4M.png](http://i.imgur.com/Lok4M.png)

I wish I could take credit for something that awesome.

I was looking for a module that would allow me to explore the new planets and moons in a more scientific way. I wanted data, informations.

And so I wrote to **Iannic-ann-od**, asking him if he could make it happen...

BUT HE WAS ALREADY MAKING IT!!!

I think I have to redesign my probes now.

Sweeeeeeet!
Dibs on mapping Bop!

I mapped ALL the things.

But I was a derp and didn't get any .csv files out of it because I didn't have the option enabled, so it was all wasted time and effort. I was primarily looking for potential landing sites. =\

Oh well, maybe the rough images will be of some use to someone...

I accidentally left my Mapsat running overnight, and now I have an 881 MB CSV file. Would anyone appreciate such a gargantuan file, and how would I upload it?

> 
> I accidentally left my Mapsat running overnight, and now I have an 881 MB CSV file. Would anyone appreciate such a gargantuan file, and how would I upload it?

Create a torrent. Only logical way to go about uploading so much data, really. O.o
I gladly volunteer myself as a writer, if and when you need one! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Thanks to the VOID module, it is now possible to study planets and moons in real time!

Here is my Moho Probe going in for an atmosphere sample. As we can see, the temperature increases alarmingly fast once you reach the upper atmosphere that starts at about 27~28km.

But even at 19km, there is too little of it to effectively aerobreak your craft.

I hope to be able to land another probe soon to get readings from the surface.

> ![screenshot86o.png](http://imageshack.us/a/img685/4822/screenshot86o.png)
> ![screenshot80v.png](http://imageshack.us/a/img337/666/screenshot80v.png)

You know what would be nice? More data! As in, if VOID could collect data points in the same way that ISA MapSat does now (okay, obviously not exactly the same way; csv output might be a good idea, however for so many different data types, something like JSON might be appropriate).

> 
> Thanks to the VOID module, it is now possible to study planets and moons in real time!

I must have missed something somewhere. VOID module??

> 
> I must have missed something somewhere. VOID module??

It's here and it gives a bunch of info on the planet, atmosphere and temperature.

Although temperature is outside the ship, so not necessarily surface temp. 

Would be nice to be able to do a surface temp map of a planet.

[http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/20373-0-17-VOID-Module-Vessel-Orbital-Information-Display?highlight=VOID](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/20373-0-17-VOID-Module-Vessel-Orbital-Information-Display?highlight=VOID)
Thanks! Added it to my list of fav mods. Not sure how that one slipped past me. lol

> 
> You know what would be nice? More data! As in, if VOID could collect data points in the same way that ISA MapSat does now (okay, obviously not exactly the same way; csv output might be a good idea, however for so many different data types, something like JSON might be appropriate).

I think you could still do that with the crx telemetry plugin. But I have never tried it and don't even know if it still works in 0.17.

I like the fact that the VOID module is so much easier to use, even if you can't record the data.
